questions: Why are floods dangerous for aquatic animals?
option1: Excess water reduces oxygen, affecting underwater life.
option2: Waterborne diseases lead to death among aquatic animals.
option3: Floods strand animals, causing death after waters recede.
option4: Sudden wetness causes aquatic animals to perish.
